summary: Relaxing brain puzzle - sort the hexagon tile blocks by color to merge them

scraped_reviews.content: The puzzles themselves are fun, the ads are becoming more intrusive. Win a game, ad. Lose a game and select try again, ad. Screen times out mid game and you open your phone back up, ad. Additionally it's the type of ads that require multiple taps to reject them or they take you automatically to the app store and you have to back out of everything. It's extremely frustrating and not worth the time anymore.

Initially I enjoyed this relaxing app, but as I played more and more, the ads dragged out for a long time and would also simply lock up, forcing me to restart the app. Ads are a necessary part of play unless you pay for tools, but as I played more, I stopped getting credit for watching ads, and the game also required more tools to keep going. It got to the point of 95% ads and 5% aggravating game that I kept quitting because of the ad irritation. Deleting my account now.

it's okay. It's not boring enough that I forget about it, but the glitches it has are hard to get past. for example, sometimes I'm playing the game that you can't lose for 7 games and all of a sudden, towards the end of it, a glitch will pull you away from the game ruining the streak that you had and starting the level over. Or another glitch that upsets me is when I go to use an ad to get a power up, and the game will glitch the ad and not give the reward! there's also ads after every game.

They appear to have updated the game and now it costs more to get anything or use anything. It used to be 10 coins to change your hand and now it is 30... It wasn't broken so they fixed it to get more money. I have the updated version and it hasn't changed. Still costs more to do anything in the game which means either more ads or inhabe to pay. I had a message with something in it but it wouldn't work and then disappeared. If you have read this far, find a different hex game.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Adam, We apologize for the inconvenience caused by this and we would like to inform you that this has been fixed in the latest app version. We request you to please update your app without deleting it. Please let us know if there are any further issues, and we will be happy to assist. Thank you for your understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: I love this game! It's absolutely addictive. My only problem is glitchy ads that shut down the app. It happens over and over. Other than that, it's a great game. Back again still got glitchy ads, makes you watch gives no rewards thinking of deleting. So turns out you are not actively working on anything. Thanks for the non working ads that freeze and give nothing after the ad is over. You said you'd work on it, you didn't, I deleted. Thanks for nothing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Angie, we are truly sorry to hear about your recent experience. Our team is actively working on a solution to this issue, and we expect a swift resolution with the next update. We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: edit: permanently deleting. all the power ups cost 2-3x as much with the most recent update. used to be good, they'd give you the option for ads to get out of losing situations but now they've taken the ads option away and it's becoming my least favorite game. my rate of play over the last few days has decreased dramatically. I liked having the ad option - I don't like paying money for games. maybe they'll bring it back but I'm not holding my breath. will probably delete soon tbh.

I don't like having to say this, but I dropped the star rating I had previously had up.... I've had this game for several months now, play it almost daily and have gotten pretty far in it. Having almost NO ads was one of the best things about this game, along with not wanting you to pay for anything and everything. However, after the latest update, I honestly think I'm going to delete the game. It wants you to pay money for everything now. No options at all now. Money only...Not impressed.

It's fun, challenging, and addicting but I have some qualms. First, I can't always tell if a stack has enough to be cleared and that will sometimes cost me the game. Some sort of indicator (maybe the stack gets highlighted?) if a certain move would stack enough to clear it would be super helpful. Second, I can't seem to figure out the pattern as to where the chips will move next to other stacks/colors. I wonder if a tutorial walking users through how the chips prioritize moves would be helpful.

Worst game ever!! I've worked my butt off to get to the diamond level. Got to first place and these two players constantly were within points behind me in 2nd and 3rd place. I mean every single time I won they seemed to just move up with me. Contacted support as they appeared to be bots. They said they'd look into it. Now those same 2 players are ahead exactly 6 and 1 point ahead of me. No matter how much I play, I can't get ahead of them and their scores are ALWAYS the same amount of points. BS

I have tried a few Hex Sort type games. The strategy and pacing are very good in this version. Smooth graphics, no annoying music, competitive and entertaining as a solo player. A few of the ads have the exit loop problem. I am on level Six and had to log out twice to get out of the ad screen. Would be a shame to delete if the ads loop traps are frequent.

I was really enjoying this game. the ads are super annoying but whatever. my biggest issue is i cant past level 17. ive tried for days now, get to over halfway to the level goal and i loose. im not spending real money for powerups so I guess I just wont ever be past this level. it would be bettee if i could know when i place tiles down which way they'll move. it feels like the game goes the opposite way then i think it will, just so ill loose and spend real money. super frustrating.

This game was fun when I posted the first review.. but right after I got ad after ad and it's not easy to exit the ads. such a repetitive ad for this stupid farm game called Township, that they literally make you play for longer than you played hexa for ! I'm getting ready to uninstall because eventually they put a game on there that was impossible to get anywhere unless you paid and that's where I draw the line. not any fun when you are forcing somebody to reach in their pocket to play.

so I love the concept, there are other games like this, so its nothing too special. i only downloaded this one for good pizza great pizza. currently stuck on a level which will require powerups, either way thats not why im rating low. $9.99 for ad removal for 30 DAYS???? that is insane. for that I can get a switch game or multiple apps. uninstalling.

I see everyone is complaining about the ads, so let me add my 2 cents. The ads are turning this fun and relaxing game into a frustrating and annoying game. I'll be in the middle of a level and an ad pops up. What makes it worse is, the only way to close the ad is to force stop the game. Which makes me lose the level and lose a life. Please fix this

I've enjoyed the game for a few days but I'm going to have to uninstall - these ads are insane. I get that developers have to make money somehow and I don't mind sitting through a regular ad here and there but these pop up after every level and are some of the scammiest ones I've seen. Some will try to force you to interact with them or sit a ridiculously long time or there will be 3-4 levels of the ad before you're given the option to X out. Not worth it.

The game is fun if you put real cash into the game. I will be uninstalling after writing this review because the (long) ads will have a glitch, only to restart the app. When I'm trying to open a space by watching an ad, and I have to then keep doing this over and over because the ad is causing the game to restart over and over again... then I have now had it. Uninstalling.

Too many ads for a game that also includes in app purchases. Can't seem to move a block without ending up on an ad that over rides anything else I'm doing on my phone. I like to listen to audiobooks while playing and the ads stop my book. Too many clicks to get out of the ads. The game itself when you get to play it between the ads, is fun and addictive. Hate that we're blackmailed into paying $10 a month to remove ads.

This is a very fun game.....And, yes, I decided to give it another try, but the ads are freezing up again. Probably wouldn't do any good, because it crashes now when I open the videos for the coins, and it crashes loading. It's completely messed up. It's just a complete glitch all over the place. YOU CAN'T GET TO IN GAME CHAT WHEN IT CRASHES BEFORE IT GETS TO THE GAME! EVERY AD DOES IT!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there, we sincerely apologize for this experience, may we please request you to contact us through the in-game Support Chat Button found in the settings panel? Our team will be able to connect with you directly and promptly look into the issue you‚Äôre facing. We would highly appreciate your cooperation.

scraped_reviews.content: I thought the point of games like this was that you wanted people to play as long as possible (so you can serve them as many ads as possible and make a bunch more money, of course) but for some reason this game limits how much you can play it. So, I'm deleting it and downloading a different version that actually allows me to play. Also the ads are AWFUL, they all require you to click at least 3 different teeny tiny x's and they always crash the game and open other apps, SUPER annoying.

A game designed to get you to spend money. Once you progress far enough, the game will seemingly only give you pieces that are completely unusable on your current board and force you to use an item that, surprise, requires money, because you can't get enough coins from the "free" sources. Even the excessive ads rarely help you actually win the level.

This game just has tons of ads. The ads can take as much as 1 minute to go through. Many of us know that 1 minute can feel like a lifetime. If the reduced time to seconds, it wouldn't be that bad. Don't bother unless you enjoy watching 1 minute ads on every level it's not JUST once in a while. IT'S ALL THE TIME!!!! I FIND IT HARD TO BELIEVE THAT THIS GAME HAS 4.5 STARS. THOSE ACCOUNTS MUST BE FAKE. I just deleted the game. READ THE OTHER REVIEWS ABOUT THIS GAME. IT'S NOT WORTH IT.

CONSTANTLY CRASHING. Especially after you watch an ad for an item, then you don't get the reward. You have to research the ads. They constantly pull you into Google play, on like half of ads (usually causes the crash). I spend more time watching ads and reloading this app, than I actually get to play. Then you finish a game/level and you get 5 coins...... THAT YOU HAVE TO WATCH ANOTHER AD FOR!?! Try any other app first. So much lost time, and IVE CONTACTED SUPPORT and NO COMPENSATION. Delete

originally I loved this game. but since the update it locks up when I try to watch an ad to get an extra space. and I agree with other commenters- sometimes you're watching what feels like a 1-3 minute ad just to get 15 coins, when the minimum thing you can "buy" with coin is 20 coins. time for me to find a different sorting/adhd brain game.

The game was simple and engaging but they've added all this gimmicky filler content and less creative maps, but rather new & tougher obstacles each round that just waste time and take away enjoyment. Mainly, the game is essentially broken due to broken ads. ex: Ad to open up a tile-full 1 minute ad that just hangs at the end. forcing a click to ">>Google play" which force closes the game, doesn't give you the tile and just 100% wastes your time. Like, REALLY?!!!!!?

im on level 536. been playing literal years. now the coin system is broken. it times out fast. I didn't mind playing at work, and it timed out bec I wracked up coins. now im forced to go through ads. and not getting any coins. and you need tools and coins to beat some levels. essentially the higher level. free space was an add watch. now are 20 coins. really frustrating.

I got to level 659. I am updating my review from 3 to 1 star. I'm tired of the adds you watch for help not working. It takes the fun out of the game when you watch an ad to get an assist, but it switches to the Google play store and when you try to swipe back to the game it kicks you to the relaunch and then you have to select the game again, which thankfully holds your progress, only to still be stuck and you have to watch an ad again. Last straw was poor customer service & charge service didn'

Can be fun but every few levels the game will basically force you to spend all your coins or use all your power ups to get past the level. Also it seems like the AI will purposely hold back specific colors that you need or flip the tiles in a way that blocks you from playing. When the game isn't frustrating like this it is pretty fun.

the ads make it unbearable. after every single round. these ads never get an x button, or a way to close the ad. you have to literally close and reopen the app every time an ad plays. you wanted to watch an ad to redeem a tiny amount of coins? you can't! because you can't close the ad, you end up rebooting the game and don't get the rewards.

worst game ever! For three days, I have tried using the free space with the ad. It will go to the ad and stay there. I once waited for over 30 minutes. When trying to end the ad, it crashes the game. I just tried after updating. It immediately did it again. Keep the $5 Walmart card. I am uninstalling. WORST GAME EVER

The ad watch feature for additional spaces or boosters is broken. EVERY SINGLE TIME I play this game, when I use the ad watch, I'll watch through the ad, and 9 times out of 10 instead of getting the reward, I'm forced into the app store. And then when I return to the game, I have to wait for the whole thing to boot up again so I can return to my game... only to find I DID NOT get my reward. Even though I watched the ad. I'm sick of this bait and switch reward system. It is incredibly unfair.

Was a good game but over the last few months it has become a money grab with increasing ads at every turn. The most recent update has moved what was ad-based free spaces to requiring in game currency (which the game is slow to award and means you have to spend real money to get more of otherwise). Deleting it now which is a shame because it was once enjoyable.

It started off as an enjoyable game. But about 8 to 10 levels in, it starts with an ad after every round. Annoying but not awful, cuz sometimes the runs can be quite challenging to clear. THEN I reached leven 18 to 20 or so, and now ads for some DC game come up that just hang. You can click on the ad and go to the shop, but after more than a minute, the ad doesn't end. Happened multiple times. Have to crash the game to continue. Not a good experience. Another game on the trash heap. Uninstalled.

it was fine for a bit- and I've done almost 500 levels, but today, something has affected the playability. When you go away from the game for a few minutes, and go back, it wants to show you an ad for another game and give you 2 coins for the "break". Now it continuously loops that ad (Hole People game), whether I let the ad play through, or not. I don't want the coins, and I don't want to install the game. I can't break the repeated loop without forcing the game to stop.

I liked this game. 2 problems. 1: on May 1st I apparently accidentally clicked something before setting my phone down, ended up accidentally purchasing the $100 coin pack. (I picked it back up and was thinking I was unlocking with fingerprint) by the time I realized, it was too late. My issue is, I never even got the coins. Also recently got a new phone and my progress had not saved and neither did my ad free purchase.

Ads galore! They touted themselves as being a game without annoying ads but they get more and more intrusive as you level up. For example, the screen timesout, ad. Game ends, ad. My final straw was when an ad popped up in the middle of game play and it launched my browser, despite not touching any of the banners or spots that are free if you watch an ad. Uninstalling this game.

after not working all day, videos are working again. occasionally seems like the disks flip in a way that hinders my ability to complete the level, so 4/5 currently, no ads work and almost all ads freeze the game. ads for bonuses, ads between levels, almost all of them require me to restart the app. the ones that don't just go back to the level without the offered reward.

The puzzles are satisfying and challenging. I genuinely had a hard time putting this game down. That being said, the number of in-game pop-ups makes it hard to achieve any sense of flow. The ads are also obnoxious: The exit buttons are inconsistently placed and often small or low contrast. it's a usability nightmare. $10 to remove ads PER MONTH is highway robbery. Especially since most of the play interruptions are in-game content anyway.

I love this app, I find it super addicting. I will say I am free to play and use ads to get the extra moves often, but the ads lately have been survey questions that dont actually do anything and just freeze the game. also the world building element is nice, but I have found that most of them the percentages keep going down instead of up.

These guys really figured out how to make a fun mobile game .. and then ran screaming in the other direction at the behest of their insatiable corporate overlords. what could be a relaxing and satisfying puzzle game is turned into a dungeon of impossible levels continually and ingeniously made all the more impossible in the attempt to squeeze you for pennies at a time after all the time I've spent on this game (and ad free $) im left with nothing but a vague regret I didnt find a better game

This app is more ad than game. Everything you do, an app is getting put in your face. They also try to get you to spend money every chance they get. The game starts out fairly fun and easy, but eventually gets to where you have to use power ups and spend more coins to best levels. All this as a ploy to try and get you to spend money. My advice is to not even download this app to begin with and play a different hex game.

The game is fun. The ads were not. ads with pop-up constantly, and most of them were 30 seconds of you just watching something, 12 seconds of waiting for a countdown, going to a page for downloading whatever the ad was for, going back to the game, waiting 5 more seconds to close out the whole thing, before you can continue with the game. and it happened constantly. a shame, because I like this game, but it's just way too frustrating.

this game used to be good. on my old phone, I was at ~level 100. had to restart on my new phone and now I'm literally STUCK at level 49 no matter how many abilities I use. I REFUSE to spend a penny on this game to be at a level.If it weren't for this trashy issue, I'd rate the game 4‚≠ê. but it gets a 1‚≠ê because they deliberately chose to have the game function in this way so that the chances of you getting the color you need are slim to none. it's not puzzle solving if the odds are against you.

Very enjoyable relaxing game - pretty much *ruined* by too many ads. Between *every* game you play, and then when you start a new one: 2-4 squares are freed up when you watch more ads - each usually feels like about 2 mins long. Very frustrating. Total overkill. It's now outweighing the relaxation element. I actually downloaded one of the games (Gossip Harbor), but the ads continued apace, and Gossip Harbor didn't even work for me. Both now uninstalled.

The initial "game" of tile matching is fun. I played until level 57, after which the game is practically unplayable unless you purchase the power ups to help you through a level. I attempted level 58 about a dozen times before giving up. Some other levels needed about 3 attempts (without power ups) but still achievable. I think I've hit a wall at my level. I won't pay money for a mobile game. Also, if you hate ads, this game is not for you. An ad plays after EVERY level.

Horribly designed game, even by the standards of ad farm slop. It's a color matching game where the RNG frequently gives you more colors than spaces. Several boards are weirdly designed, missing spaces or having them blocked off by ads which CRASH YOUR GAME and don't reward you. The worst are the idiotic "free the car" levels where the car will drive directly into the space you need to use to make a match. The devs can't use enough common sense to make a game that's tolerable, let alone fun.

I played this game for a few months. both the ads and the images on the ads in the play link for this game are not the game that actually installs. the actual game itself is fine, except the ads are horrendous, often opening websites on their own outside of the game. the further you get in levels the more impossible it is to play without boosters, whether you watch a 30-60 second ad per or pay an egregious amount of money for them. there are better hex sort games out there. this one ain't it.

I genuinely enjoy this game at it's base. However, the game itself, like so many other mobile games, exists to make you watch ad after ad after ad. Even if you spend the eight bucks to eliminate mandatory ads, the game is structured in a way that it's almost impossible to progress without using the boosters, which cost coins that in turn cost money or, you guessed it, watching more ads. Or, you can unlock extra spaces by watching ads. Don't waste your time or money.

this game used to be one of my favorites. ads aren't too overwhelming (although it can be annoying to get one every single time you leave and re-enter the app), levels are fairly easy. it's a nice way to pass time. but ever since the most recent update, it feels like 2/3 of the levels are nearly impossible to complete & you never know which stacks are the right size. and with only 5 lives and how difficult getting power-ups is, it takes forever. still fun, but i'm immensely disappointed.

The game could have been fun. I don't always mind ads. Sometimes, I see something I might want to try. But I paid $7.99 for no ads, and these repetitive and insipid ads for things I will NEVER want to play keep interrupting my game play at random intervals. The whole "press to build" at the end of each level is pointless and a boring, annoying waste of time that presents no interesting challenge at all. I gave it a fair shot, but it's not worth my time and a complete waste of money.

A fun puzzle game that ads new mechanics and keeps things interesting. Not too many ads. In-game purchases are not required for starter progression. After level 300, it becomes nearly impossible to progress without spending real money on the game. I decreased the number of stars for that reason. Also, as the puzzles become more difficult, the inconsistent and unclear internal logic of the game becomes more and more frustrating to the point I plan on deleting the game entirely.

title: Substack
description:
Substack is a new media app that connects you with the creators, ideas, and communities you care about most.

+ Support the creators you love: Subscribe for free or upgrade to view original work and connect directly with your favorite writers, artists, and podcasters.

+ Enjoy ad-free videos and podcasts: Access short-form clips, video episodes, and  read-aloud articles without interruptions.

+ Connect in real time: Join livestreams and live group chats, where top creators bring their biggest supporters into their world. 

+ Explore independent ideas: Discover bold opinions and engaging views across food, sports, politics, fashion, comedy, finance, and more.

How it works:
1. Download the Substack app.
2. Claim your handle.
3. Explore the feed to enjoy notes, videos, and clips from creators. 
4. Subscribe to your favorites for free, tune into their livestreams and join private group chats.
descriptionHTML:
Substack is a new media app that connects you with the creators, ideas, and communities you care about most.

+ Support the creators you love: Subscribe for free or upgrade to view original work and connect directly with your favorite writers, artists, and podcasters.

+ Enjoy ad-free videos and podcasts: Access short-form clips, video episodes, and read-aloud articles without interruptions.

+ Connect in real time: Join livestreams and live group chats, where top creators bring their biggest supporters into their world.

+ Explore independent ideas: Discover bold opinions and engaging views across food, sports, politics, fashion, comedy, finance, and more.

How it works:
1. Download the Substack app.
2. Claim your handle.
3. Explore the feed to enjoy notes, videos, and clips from creators.
4. Subscribe to your favorites for free, tune into their livestreams and join private group chats.
summary: Videos, writing, podcasts & more

scraped_reviews.content: Does most of what I need, but doesn't always work as intended. For example, when I send out a test version of a newsletter, I get a notification via the app saying I can read it there. This function has never worked. Additionally, not being able to edit newsletters from the app is super unhelpful. Overall, both the app and the web version could be more user friendly. The taxonomy needs a lot of work. Aside from that, I like the app and the Substack platform.

Not worth the trouble. Since this app was first introduced, it's gone from bad to worse. It doesn't update activity reliable, and posts I've already read remain as unread for days. As often as not, the list of Notes cycles through the same 4 or 5 notes repeatedly, instead of continuing down the list. It regularly recommends new writers to me that write on subjects that are practically the antithesis of the stuff I tend to read, and it's not possible to edit a comment like you can in the browser.

While full of amazing content, the app is ephemeral when one switches away to another app. Substack disappears from the app switcher, even losing one's place in the current article. If you don't immediately like an article there is no history to help you find the same article, leaving you lost from something you might want to continue reading. It's almost better to open an article in a browser tab to make sure the article doesn't get lost forever.

There are many functionality issues with this app from crashes to drafts not syncing between it and the PC as well as very few features. However, not even being able to log in or get the app to send an email to let me unlock it after it randomly logged me out takes the cake. What is even the point? If you wanted to be desktop only you should've just stayed that way.

Not intuitive at all. I can't find how to only receive my subscription when listening in autoplay mode. Very frustrating and intrusive when I'm listening to it, and then some other content I didn't ask for or want starts squawking in my ears. There should be a way to read/listen ONLY to what I paid for. Do better, Substack.

For something so innovative and popular, the navigation is atrocious. You go round and round, seemingly at random, trying to access basic features like editing a piece, or viewing a list of your paid subscribers. (Still haven't figured that one out.) Substack couldn't make this more difficult if they tried.

Overall, a well done app but the experience of subscribing to get access to a post is terrible. It requires switching to a browser, logging in, finding the writer you want to subscribe to, subscribing, having to enter a credit card in the process (does substack even support saving credit cards?). Then you go back to the app to continue reading, but the app doesn't know you have a subscription, so you need to exit the article to find it again. You would get more subscriptions with less friction

As a service, great. As an app, not so much. There are redundancies everywhere, but other things that can't be found or seemingly can't be done in the app at all. The website functions and navigates somewhat differently so bouncing between can be frustrating. The app finally stopped crashing and removing itself from the carousel every time I switched away from it, but now the bar to like and comment from will not show up in a post. We had a good month or so in there where it all worked well.

It's undeniably one of the coolest apps I've downloaded. I've barely begun to dive fully into its capabilities. I knew the first substack I was subscribing too and it's been an outstanding way to read and listen to poetry, philosophy, and all the other intricacies I find myself seeking. 10/10 if you are seeking a solid app with value in its information and setup.

The app decides to play random podcasts from people I've never heard of without any interaction. It even recently did this when I didn't even have the app open and wouldn't stop when I closed the app. I had to open Substack and stop it in the app. The media control is still there, it's just blank now. The app also frequently disappears from the app switcher. However, the actual content on Substack is very good.

SUBSTACK STOP PUSHING AUDIO AT ME Every time I open the app, it starts playing a random audio post, often by people I'm not even subscribed to! The posts are clogging up my history so I can't even find posts I listened to/read ON PURPOSE! Now, even if I restart my phone and I haven't TOUCHED the app, it'll stick a random post that I DON'T LIKE in my 'now playing' on my phone! AND I CANT GET RID OF IT I'm uninstalling. This is RIDICULOUS

Terrible for writers! DO NOT write in the app. It will NOT be saved or recoverable! Got this app because I'm a blogger. I'm down a computer rn and am looking for a monetized platform for blogging through an app. Guess I'll have to KEEP looking! This app is NOT like the Substack Website! If you are a writer, avoid the app at all costs! It has no button in the app for finding your drafts or editing them!! This is strictly a reading app but if you look for a Substack Writer app, there isn't one!

Good idea, horrible execution. It's a glorified mailing list, and it sends an email for EVERY individual article published in a subscription. Even when you select "prefer push". No daily/weekly summaries option. I don't want to read the articles in email, I want to read them in the app. The only way to avoid the emails is to unsubscribe from the creator, which defeats the purpose. The UI is unintuitive and clunky. Articles in the app have to be archived one at a time, no opt for multi select.

Great platform, but the Android app has issues rendering text in articles. I've also used the iOS app which offers a wide variety of fonts and sizes, but the Android app is limited to Tiempos, which is a good font, but it can render oddly on different screen sizes and resolutions, giving the text a very jagged and messy look unless you make the text comically large. Please fix the text rendering side of the app, then it'll be perfect. Feature parity with iOS is a must.

love the app and wish it stays this way with no reels type feature or excessive ads and AI pushed on you . I feel like theres a genuine connection between you and others. this is what social media is supposed to be. however, I've had a problem that I find quite annoying. I can't seem to upload posts or notes or even write comments on notes using the app.. however I can do so on the browser version. if you can fix this definitely would give 5‚òÜ edit: Please fix your app, now it's not even opening

I have been thoroughly enjoying this app until the July 31st, '25 update. I tend to listen to the articles but "stack" them up, and it no longer has that option anymore, as well as having the option to play the next article. Granted, some of the computer voices are ridiculous, but that makes it sort of amusing to listen to.

Good content, terrible UI. Comments disappear after writing them. No search functionality or ability to view just a single comment thread. You can't pay for subscriptions in the app, but when I try to pay in the browser it keeps redirecting me back to the app. Half the things I click on do nothing. There's no history of things I was reading so I have no way to go back and find or refer to things later.

This app is good, but some features on this platform are confusing. There is a difference between "following"someone and "subscribing" to them. There is also no way to subscribe to someone and just receive notifications in-app, the articles WILL get emailed to you too, unless you block them through your email, which is bad design on Substack's part. It's a great app for making reading more approachable and less intimidating.

Using the app is more frustrating than viewing substack in the browser. When I leave the app, it doesn't appear in recent apps, so I can't return to it except by restarting the app, which loses my place. When I select text, I get a three item context menu "Copy Restack Cancel". There's no web search option. There shouldn't be a Cancel, because clicking outside the menu should dismiss it, as it does in every other app with a context menu.

Substack push the app hard but the app makes it hard to see your subscriptions without pushing lots of dross. At least improve your recommendation algorithm if you are going to do that, I'm drowning in üí©. If I do mark something as 'show less of this' I lose my place and have to scroll all the way back past the same posts again. It's sometimes a bit slow too. I use it only because a few writers I like are on the platform.

I received a notice that a Subatack I subscribed to that I never use, is automatically renewing. I've spent 15 minutes plus so far trying to figure out how to cancel the subscription on the app. Totally frustrating experience. I will never again pay for a Substack subscription because they make it ao difficult to cancel. I'm done with this and will simply protest any charge with my credit card company.

I uninstalled the app because it stopped loading and force-quitting was not fixing it. I couldn't even look at the mobile site on my phone because it kept launching the app. Even after uninstalling, I had to switch to desktop mode and patiently wait for pages to load. I must've spent 15 mins just trying to subscribe to a new writer. Wondering if it's a server issue since everything else works fine on my cell. Hopefully I can redownload when the app is fixed

I get newsletters from a few people on Substack. I downloaded the app to hear a podcast. I had no idea that clicking on "interests" would subscribe me to so many subscriptions. Trying to unsubscribe is frustrating and difficult. It takes longer to scroll through notifications than I have time for. I hope I don't lose the newsletters I love. That's a battle for another day.

Meh. Not loving the UI. Kinda difficult to navigate. It's awkward for writing because the part of the screen you're writing on is covered by the keyboard. Correcting typos is frustrating. Was hoping to use it to write but I don't like to be annoyed while I'm writing. It's nice being able to read what friends write and discover new people writing interesting stuff.

It's frustrating writing a comment in response to a writer's posted article or update. I find it's impossible to go back and correct a typo, insert or remove text. Invariably the app will freeze up and suddenly take me back to the beginning of the writer's article so that I have to scroll down to the bottom again and start all over to post a comment. That's a ridiculous. I shouldn't have to use another app to type/speak a comment & then copy paste it in Substack.

I am getting charged twice a month for a single subscription and there has been no way to resolve, no customer service support. I have tried to cancel, but it doesn't work (I tried it again - maybe it'll work this time but I doubt it). Also, the only way to cancel a sub is to use the website, which is super clunky on mobile. I love the content creators I follow, but there needs to be support for billing issues.

This app is absolutely horrendous. I don't want to be bombarded with either push notifications or emails. None of them. I just want to be able to check in on accounts I follow at a time of my choosing and find them there iny account to read. You provide no way on doing this, and I am plagued by continual push notifications and a clogged email inbox. What a stupidly designed platform. I am deleting my account, uninstalling the app and telling the accounts I had subscribed to why. Substack sucks.

I love Substack for content. However, both the app and site drive me batty. As i scroll while reading, the top and bottom expand down as if it was a Flash-based menu, obscuring the text. If I could turn it off, it would be ok, but we can't. The constant jumping of the top and bottom inch and a half of the phone screen is extremely distracting. I also realize I'm a digital hoarder, so I tried turning off emails, but then somehow, I don't get app notifications for everything.

I really like the platform, but the reading experience is poor. Every time you open the app, it goes back to a home page instead of where you last were, so if I'm in the middle of an article, i have to go find it again. There's also no "recently read" feature, so i have to go to my subscriptions and dig for whatever I was reading. Very frustrating

I was hoping this app would be a "Reader" with functions to make *reading* easier. Would be nice to be able to adjust text "size" or "zoom" photos in subs. And, I have a "connectivity" issue if I leave the app open or take "too long" to read or take "too long" to type a comment on paid subs, I get "there was an error loading comments" and the "little red circling" buffering thing. It's much easier to read the subs in my browser.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Michele! The next release (coming in the next few days) should fix these issues you're seeing. If not, please shoot me an email with the steps you're taking and if possible a screenshot/recording of what's happening: jamil[at]substackinc.com. Looking forward to getting this fixed for you!

scraped_reviews.content: Pretty appalling UI, actually. Like under "Activity", if someone replies to a comment, there's no way to get to the thread or even view the comment they replied to. That's not even beta quality. Also, if I accidentally select some text in an article, I can't deselect by tapping elsewhere or scrolling. I have to choose from the pop-up menu to make it go away.

I like being able to access, read, and comment on my growing number of Substack subscriptions. However, as the owner of a Substack newsletter (or three) I was dismayed to find I couldn't use it to compose a post! And I had such a great idea! Am I missing a tab? Please make this capability available and I'll really enjoy the Substack experience. Even more points if I can use the app to record a podcast or audio comment from my phone.

I enjoy reading the articles, but the app is amateurish at best. An app primarily for reading should not have autoplaying videos. This feature alone keeps me from using it anywhere in public. Also, articles should open at the beginning, not some random place near the middle or end. Seriously, I've had 10 year old students who could do a better job. Maybe fire your development team and take it to a middle school. They might rename it Skibbidy Stack but it would probably work better.

There are a lot of great authors to follow. This is now my primary source of news. OTOH, the user experience leaves a lot to be desired: I can't edit my own comments, can't organize saved posts in folders, can't search by text in posts, don't seem to have access to "manage subscription" options from the mobile app to fine tune which posts I want notifications for...

Irrespective of the content, and there are some good writers on substack (if you want to subscribe to them), the app is extremely bug-gy. Windows Web access works slightly better, but the Android app is one frustration after another. I've waited a couple of months before posting this in case I got more familiar, but it hasn't improved. It's also extraordinarily slow. It doesn't show up in the view of open apps, 'close all' doesn't close it, what you are typing can be lost if you switch apps...

I'd absolutely love this app, the whole idea of it, if one big thing were changed: volume of authors. You could have a great app if you allowed packaging authors, pref by letting people choose several for a particular price. I'd consider becoming a paying member if I got a newspaper's worth for a similar amount. As is, it's just too expensive. A year of the Guardian is only slightly more.

The app disappears if you try to switch to a different app (long standing issue), I can't see more than 2 comments at a time all of a sudden AND if I don't check it enough for their liking they start sending me emails for every person I follow. I don't want EMAILS! So I unsubscribed from everything except my original one paid subscription. No chance of me subscribing to anything else, because this is too freaking annoying. Fix your basic stuff instead of adding new features. Do not recommend.

Great publications, if you can get to them. This app is the single worst way to access the publications you might want to read. The landing page is pretty useless, but the inbox, where you can get a chronological list of articles from the publications you've actually subscribed to? Also useless. They removed any kind of reasonably easy archive functions, and never had bulk actions. How can anyone be expected to keep up if their inbox is an endless scroll?

I signed up and made the mistake of subscribing to some newsletters that sounded interesting. What I had hoped for was to have these presented to me when I logged in to the app. Instead, I got bombarded with dozens of emails every day! Very difficult to turn it off, too. Substack is definitely more trouble than it's worth, so I deleted my account. Now I will uninstall the app, and good riddance to it.

I think the app is a bit undercooked for a service that otherwise has been a godsend for writers, and readers of writers, alike. The content on here is great, but two pretty critical things are missing from this app. First, there is no ability to adjust font size, which is crucial for accessibility, and it just helps with eye strain on higher resolutions. Second, not being able to work on your drafts in the app itself, instead having to use a browser, can be a real pain.

It would be great if there was an option to mark an article as unread. Sometimes I scroll through an article to see how long it is before reading it, but then it gets marked as read. Sometimes the app can lag quite a bit and be unresponsive. Overall, I really appreciate what Substack stands for an how it enables open discussion that is being crushed elsewhere.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Steven! The next release (coming in the next few days) should fix this one-off bug affecting a small group of readers. If you update and still see the issue, please shoot me an email with the steps you're taking and if possible a screenshot/recording of what's happening: jamil[at]substackinc.com. Looking forward to getting this fixed for you!

scraped_reviews.content: I subscribe to thirty authors; the app is only displaying the nine most recent articles. There is no way to dismiss articles I've read so I can view more. The font of the body text is a small, hard to read serif font, without the ability to change or resize it. I cannot copy media links in the app to the system clipboard so I can view them in their native apps. It is too easy to accidentally bring up a [copy - restack] dialog while attempting to scroll, and no way to dismiss it.

Some gripes, but the potential is there So I only have one channel follow, but he's got great content I'm looking for, His videos run 5 to 20min depending on the day. My biggest issue is if I pause and "alt tab" to another app I can't get the video to resume, I have to close the app and go back to it. The next issue is, there is no Fullscreen option on the videos? That's absolutely Unacceptable and really negatively impacts the information I'm trying to gather. And videos let screen to time out

I installed this after subscribing to my first substack. The experience is okay if all you want to do is read the article. In many other ways, the mobile browser experience on your phone is better. For example, if you're going back to an article you already read, there's no "find in page" search option!? This seems like a basic thing in an article reading app.

I used to like the app, but a recent update has made it so links are automatically shortened. This cuts off sentences mid-word, sometimes multiple times per post. This is completely unacceptable, and needs to be fixed immediately. If the author wanted to make the link shorter, they would have written their post that way. EDIT The issue with the links has been resolved!

Good to be able to have articles from my Substack subscriptions read aloud to me, but I can't stand that EVERY encounter with quotation marks says "end quote," both before & after the quote. This makes the listening experience very confusing, & there are no settings available to adjust it, and NO WAY to reach or request any kind of tech support. There is only a limited list of FAQs, none of which touch on this. Also, there's only a play/pause button in the app, & no back button or progress bar.

after each video I listen to, a certain podcast keeps get queued up and plays. I used to subscribe to it but deleted the subscription. I deleted the app and reinstalled it but even that does not solve the problem. Adding the simple feature of blocking a podcast channel would fix it immediately if it is too hard to correct it otherwise. This is really turning me off toward this application!

The content I wanted (Borowitz Report) is good, but the substack experience is lacking. Trying to create a login seemed to include a spiral of log-in-this-way/no-login-that-way prompts. Perhaps if I had the app installed first, it would have been better. Once I got into the app, it quickly turned into a data harvesting/don't you want all this other content too? kind of thing that puts me off. I want this one thing, so I'll try to ignore substack in favor of that, I guess.

Unauthorized account withdrawal. Canceled a subscription on Substack a couple of days ago, and they are still trying to withdraw payment from my bank account! Yes, I know how to unsubscribe from services and have done so several times now. And for some reason, they took it upon themselves to keep the subscription active just in case I change my mind evidently. This needs to stop immediately!! I would rate it 0 stars if I could.

The world's in dire need of independent, unbiased, decimination of news. This app has the potential to be a game changer. However, they have a lot of work to do. Nothing is intuitive. it's difficult to sort publications or save articles in lists. I've deleted it several times for the email/push notifications, alone. After learning a workaround, I've finally gotten that in check. Most importantly, there is a wealth of great content. Please make it easier to agrigate this wonderful content.

title: Postmates - Food Delivery
description:
Delivery from your favorite restaurants, grocery stores, and more! 24/7, 365 days a year. Postmates gets you what you want, when you want it.

FIND YOUR FAVORITE RESTAURANTS Browse nearby restaurants. Choose from a variety of selections to order: Pizza. Burritos. Burgers. Sushi. Chinese food. Skip the line and reservations. Order from any menu and add it to your cart with a few taps. Get it as soon as possible or schedule your delivery in advance and set when you want it delivered

GROCERY, CONVENIENCE, RETAIL AND MORE Get household items from your favorite local stores, supermarkets, and even pet stores. Order baby food, diapers, pharmacy, beauty products and cosmetics. Grab your staples like bread, eggs, milk, meats, fruits and veggies. All delivered to your door.

REAL-TIME ORDER TRACKING Track your food order in app as it heads your way. See the estimated delivery time to your address. Get notified when your order arrives.

EASY PICKUP or NON-CONTACT DELIVERY You can order food ahead for Pickup instead of just ordering delivery. Select Pickup, add food items to your cart and go to the restaurant to get your food. Choose no-contact delivery option and have deliveries left at your doorstep.

PROMOTIONAL TERMS $10 off your next order terms and conditions: Up to $10 off your next order. Offer valid when you download and log in the new Postmates app only. Tax & fees still apply. Store and offer availability based on user location. Limit 1 use per customer. Offer is not sharable or transferable. Offer only valid for 14 days from log in to the new Postmates app. Exclusions may apply. Offer cannot be redeemed for cash or like exchanges. Postmates reserves the right to modify or terminate this offer at any time without notice.

Delivery from your favorite restaurants, grocery stores, and more! 24/7, 365 days a year. Postmates gets you what you want, when you want it.

FIND YOUR FAVORITE RESTAURANTS Browse nearby restaurants. Choose from a variety of selections to order: Pizza. Burritos. Burgers. Sushi. Chinese food. Skip the line and reservations. Offer only valid for 14 days from log in to the new Postmates app. Exclusions may apply. Offer cannot be redeemed for cash or like exchanges. Postmates reserves the right to modify or terminate this offer at any time without notice.
summary: Local eats & grocery delivery to your door. Order your groceries with Postmates!

scraped_reviews.content: By the time you pay the increased prices & all the fees (not including any tip) you are paying at least twice as much than in store prices. I have tried to take advantage of a few promotion discounts but then they revoke them just as soon as it shows in my account. It still shows in my account but they will not work. Customer service says they have been revoked. Yet, the app continues to send me reminders to use them... Useless app, and worse customer service. So many better options out there.

I used to love ordering from this place. until everywhere I ordered they didn't give me the items Ive asked for. what was frustrating was they didn't refund me for the items they didn't give me. I've been trying to contact postmates. but every number they have online goes straight to a dead end. it hasn't been one or 2 orders they've missed. its been several. have I received anything from them ? no . im so mad now. they are causing so much fraudulent and frustration. I've let months pass.

They were great before but started service fees, so watch out. They put free delivery for members, but they charge extra service fees. Click on the little i it tells you what the service fee is for and it includes delivery. I just paid a whole lot of money for a dinner for two. It was cold and incomplete. Because I could not produce photos of the missing items i only got partial refund. And then they ended the chat. I pay for membership. I will dispute the charge with my bank.

You know an app's customer service went downhill when they ask you to provide feedback on your experience but remove the UI that lets you leave the feedback. . . I'm expected to film myself opening my food every time because on the off chance something is missing they expect proof. I've had food missing and asked to provide proof, so unboxing videos are the only thing I can do. I'll get an automated response 12 hours later saying "we aren't refunding you, it's final" and they close the ticket.

A lot of delivery apps hide their fees and prices, but this one has the worst price hiding I have ever seen in one of these apps. The cost of their fees are NOT shown at all at check out. this means that you will be shown one price on screen but charged more if you look at your bank statement . Customer support claims that fees are listed in terms and conditions, and that is why they do not list them before you hit purchase. Expect to pay $15 to $20 more than what is shown at checkout.

Was good until it wasn't. Been using the app for quite a while. I had my share of incomplete/incorrect orders that, for the most part, were resolved. My last order was incorrect(really the last several orders) all the way down to the drinks. Customer service has gotten horrible. Basically, I provided the proof that was asked for and got an "oh well" in other words. This situation alone isn't the sole reason for my review being this way. It's the fact that this had become a common issue.

I've been screwed over by these guys way too many times now. 4 to be exact. I simply want to pay for food, and have it brought to me. Very simple. Yet 4 different times "something went wrong" as costumer service puts it and I've had to recieve a refund and end up with no food until I order from somewhere else. Use another app y'all. Postmates is not worth your time.

I was disappointed. I knew about the $2.99 delivery fee but not the service fee. I wasn't given a summary of the order, costs, fees, etc. before the card was charged. This was a group order and each person was not allowed to pay their own order nor was I allowed to split the order. Nor could I add a person who didn't have the app (phone) or e-mail separately. Especially in this time, it did not allow me to add a tip.

It's alright but there's no way to talk to your deliverer. We've actually gotten the wrong order a couple of times and couldn't undo the situation. Also if there's a mistake it's very clumsy to navigate where on the app you can contact someone to help you. When it works, it works. When it doesn't, you're driving to the restaurant to get your food only to find out that the server and deliverer switched orders around and all you can do is email the company.

For several months, I have been a happy user of postmates. However, with both the small cart price hiked up and the CA mandatory service fee, what should have been a $12-15 order without a small cart fee is now $20. In my opinion, I think that's way too much for an order from Wendy's for one person. Just wasted $10 on another month of unlimited, too. Very disappointed, to say the least.

Great service, but there should be a better way to resolve problems when your order is wrong or incomplete, which it is literally 50% of the time. That is usually the restaurants fault, I get that. But instead of a credit, Postmates should send another driver over with the missing item/corrected order. It shouldn't be so hard to get exactly what you've ordered. Having said that, it's super handy. If you haven't tried it, do! True decadence to have dinner delivered from anywhere, anytime! üòãüëç

The company is having issues with the drivers credit cards (which is how they pay the restaurants), so orders keep showing up very late and cold or are cancelled after already waiting 45 minutes. I wouldn't recommend this service until they sort out their issues. Edit: One driver actually kept my food. The company no longer has phone support at all. They have done nothing to make up for the consistently horrible service. I do not type this lightly.

Beware ordering from Postmates. There are some restaurants they can't confirm the price. This just happen to me today. The price more than double compare to the advertising price is. This is purely faults advertising and scam. This is what they reply me  "we are not able to confirm how much items will cost until your Postmate arrives at the merchant and finalizes the order. Prices may change once the order is complete." Don't sell them if you can confirm the price. It's that simple...

Have used this app a few times, and it seems like every time there has been a problem with my order. Either food is missing or I received someone else's order entirely. On this last occasion, the driver picked the food up and never delivered it, but marked the app as 'delivered'. Rather than investigate the issue, Postmates said sorry, sucks to be you and refused to refund my order. I feel bad for restaurants that subscribe to Postmates because ultimately they're the ones who don't get paid.

I saw an ad for postmates so thought I'd try it out. Huge mistake. I placed my first order, but after seeing the app constantly push back the delivery time (eventually it was pushed out by more than half an hour from the original delivery time), I finally got a notification more than an hour after placing the order saying my order had been canceled because there weren't enough postmates around. They had over an hour to communicate with me and set expectations but instead waited and did nothing, until they decided to cancel my order out of the blue. Now I'm very hungry and very upset. I refuse to believe that this service isn't set up as a scam.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback, & my apologies for any inconvenience you may have experienced with our service in this regard. If you don't mind, please reply to the email that will be generated from this response with the email associated with your Postmates account. We will be happy to look into this further and get it fixed.

scraped_reviews.content: Don't use Postmates, it's not worth the frustration. They've messed up my order the last 5 times I've used them by completely leaving off entrees. And customer support basically says, "well, based on the final receipt, we didn't charge you for it, so it's all good!" Maybe your menu prices should reflect the actual prices so you're not scamming customers... Don't bother getting Unlimited either. It's not always free delivery.

Service fees are way too high. It's up to like 25% which is often like doubling (or more) the tax+delivery fee amounts. We've also had issues with customer service and you can't even call anyone for assistance now which is very frustrating when something goes wrong with your order. Hopefully they can make some improvements on these things.

Almost everything about this app is inconvenient. It is also a bit more expensive than the other delivery apps. You are only given one line for directions, which is a problem if you have a difficult to find apartment. You end up talking to every single driver and explain them how to get there. Also, their premium service is by the year not by the month. This model deceptively scammy.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, and my apologies for any inconvenience you may have experienced with our service recently. If you don't mind, reply to the email that will be generated from this response, with the email associated with your Postmates account. I will be happy to look into this further and get this fixed.

scraped_reviews.content: If you use doordash you can get the same stuff cheaper. Postmates charges fees to the food itself (that I didnt know about until my order didnt show so I ordered again from a different app) and then they will charge you a small delivery fee, if under $15, and then a delivery fee, and then for some reason the tax is also higher than doordash, and then on top of all that you should pay your driver a tip. First experience with this app was all around awful. Will not be using this one again.

UPDATE: I decided to give the app another try, first few orders were ok. Then I got an order that was completely wrong. I alerted them and my order was immediately refunded (minus the delivery fee). The next order had a missing item, when I reported that I was told that after reviewing my account they wouldn't refund me for my missing item. When I inquired why I just got the same automated response. So now I'm done, no more chances, uninstalled the app, and unsubscribed from the email list.

Worst delivery app!!!! I have used it for 3 months, at first was nice but so slow now and customers don't tip. It takes days to get the tips they do give.. If you have a problem expect an hour hold time to get help then if they have to cancel it you won't get paid. There is always errors. The card declines, they send you to the wrong locations and don't compensate for it. The list goes on.

You can't place an order unless a Postmate is close enough and it's not too busy. Sounds potentially okay, til every time you look at the app and only have 0-3 options. Also take into account there's only like a 30% chance that your order will go through and actually be delivered. So many times I've ordered then 2 hours later get a "Sorry your order has been canceled" notification. Also my last order resulted in getting charged for numerous items/fees I never recieved. Awful, just causes stress.

A few issues: We've had several mess ups with our orders. We've gone to the same place a dozen times to pick it up, and never once had an issue until we used Postmates. They'll give you a partial refund, but it's definitely frustrating when you get something you can't eat. Also, I hate that they send notifications all the time for codes for free delivery/$5 off. But if you don't see the code or forget it, it's just gone. I don't see a way to find the code they just offered.

Update: Somehow they made this app even worse! Prices are up again, delivery is now routinely $10+ for just the delivery fee. Not even to mention taxes and their service fee. Prev: Constantly offers "discounts" and promo codes, then when I go to use them (within 2 minutes of receiving the offer) it says "Not eligible for this promotion" or "This promotion is no longer available". Every! Time! Stop lying about discounts and promotions to get people to order, only for those things not to work.

A couple times now I've had issues that refuse to resolve. There is no support number. You can send a support ticket but they only resolve it without communicating anything to you. Most recent example, I received the wrong order, and all I have is the ticket saying resolved. No refund or anything. I will update this as soon as I find out if I was still overcharged, for the food I received did not match what I payed, even including the delivery fee.

Support is absolutely useless, prices are high, and delivery is slow. Look elsewhere. I placed my first order on the app a week ago. It was supposed to be delivered in 40-55 minutes. After nearly 2 hours, I got a notification saying my order was cancelled. I also got an email saying "a credit has been added to your account. You will not be charged for this order and don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt see the credit in your account - it will be applied automatically on your next order." A few days ago I went to place another order. Again it said 40-55 minutes. Actual delivery was more like 1.5 hours, but I did get the food. However, it was missing one of the things I ordered, and the credit I was promised did not show up in the final order total. I contacted support and they told me that despite nothing in the email or notification, the order credit had any mention of an expiration date. 5 back and forth emails each got a different person responding with the same useless response and no apparent acknowledgement that I had already seen that response. I have uninstalled the app and will not be using this service again.

Been with Postmates for a while, but I'm officially "one strike" away from deleting my account after an otherwise great experience in 2015/2016. The app now notifies you that a Postmate is "here and will wait up to 5 minutes" even though the Postmate has always been at least a few minutes away when I receive that notice, and the proxy number system makes it very hard to communicate with the Postmate despite the fact that they're running the clock on you. Combine this with an almost completely automated "support team" that rarely reads your requests to them unless you respond repeatedly to them. They have also stopped offering a delivery credit for when they screw up, which used to make up for errors IMO. Support will automatically reject any requests for a refund, even if the Postmate stomped on your food in front of you, so you'll have to enjoy getting lost in the weeds of trying to reach a human being just to NOT be charged for something you never received. Overall, unless something changes, this might be the end of the era where Postmates was the best around. Will update if I encounter further issues! UPDATE - Deleted the app and using competitors and already wish I had left sooner. Customer service could not care less that they're losing customers, ironic because I would have subscribed to Unlimited if the app didn't consistently have the issues I face every time. Good riddance, and I recommend everyone jump ship now before it gets any worse.

Simply put, this is the most expensive of the food delivery apps. This one is ridiculous in my opinion. I have a standing order at a zaxbys restaurant near my house, it's always $14 when I get it myself. On this app my total for same order is $24, not including the tip. So my order becomes twice the price. There is a service fee, (using the app) a delivery fee (a whopping $6) AND they raise the menu prices by a few dollars. And of course tip. So by using this app you have 4 additional charges.

IF YOU HAVE AN OLDER VERSION DO NOT UPDATE THE APP!!! This merger has made the entire app interface hideous and unorganized, from the home screen to the ordering menu it's all atrocious. They don't even text you when your driver is coming anymore so now they just show up at your door unannounced. The customer service is harder to contact now instead of it being instantaneously, and the "credits" they give you now disappear after you order so you end up paying full price in the end!!

Horrible app because this is a horrible service. Doesn't list all places in area that deliver using "postmates." Lets you begin your order; then at the last moment, before paying, tells you the restaurant is "closed." Also, OVERCHARGES for all menu items: meals, combos, specials, a la carte, beverages, etc. This, regardless of if the order is "free delivery" or not. Over time, this becomes increasingly WORSE, with prices gradualky increasing until you are eventually paying double.

Postmates is AWESOME. My only issue is that... A lot of the menus don't offer the option to order a specific amount of condiments. For example... If I order Arby's, I would like to have multiple Arby's Sauce per item but... I only have the ability to order 1. If I order Chipotle Bowl, I would like a side of Hot Sauce or Soft Taco tortillas on the side. They need to do a better job of creating their menu's. I have absolutely no problem paying extra to get what I like.

Does what it says just fine, however their policies regarding certain issues that may arise during or after an order need to be revised. for example, i spent half an hour speaking to various support staff before i got a refund for items i had ordered but not received, due to the store being out. my refund was met with a 9.99 delivery fee, where before, my delivery was free. only way they could sort that out was to give it back in delivery credit. all in all, not satisfied, now wary of using app.

DO NOT USE THIS APP. I ordered food and the next day noticed they charged me an extra $10. When I inquired as to why I received the additional charge, they tell me that unless a restaurant has a green check mark (which I have yet to see one that does) the prices are subject to change. Which they do not let you know this before ordering. So even though THEY are the ones who have the wrong price listed, YOU are the one that has to pay for their mistake. You're better off using any another app.

Not gonna lie, this was a good app to use to order food. However, everytime I've ordered for the past 2 months, it's been not so well. There's always an item that's missing, or there happens to be a charge fee.. My best solution for anyone would be not to order from them and go with another delivery company. Plus they keep most of the profit for themselves and don't pay their drivers enough. That's my 2 cents at least.

I originally gave this app three stars, but after ordering an expensive meal that never arrived, you get one! I would rate zero if that were an option. Here's the deal people, I understand that it's convenient to order food and have it delivered, but you're better off picking it up at the restaurant, or cooking at home to save even more money. Screw you postmates, you won't be getting any more of my hard earned money!

The WORST delivery app out there. They take 2 hrs to deliver something & then cancel after you've waited 2 hours!!! They ALWAYS forget something in the order and then don't want to refund you the amount. If you get anything back they'll offer "credit". I don't want credit! I don't want to use your service again! COMPLETELY USELESS! Save your money and sanity... Stick with ubereats or seamless!

Better restaurant selection, AWFUL app. Have used postmate twice and I am 2/2 on incorrect orders. The promo code for my first order just vanished when the app crashed, then said it had already been claimed so I had it pay full price. Menus are incorrect on just about every place I've checked. The tip option being at after delivery makes it forgettable and that's bad for your workers. Doordash without their "premium service" is also cheaper, with a better app, and more accurate options.

This is the first and last time I'll use this app. My actual order was $20 but by the time they got done with their fees, it was $47 plus there was no way to avoid adding a tip (unless I missed it) I understand having a delivery charge, but this was ridiculous. No need to ask me to email anyone, I'm writing this after I've done that. Back to UberEats for me!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, and my apologies for any inconvenience you may have experienced with our service recently. If you don't mind, reply to the email that will be generated from this response, with the email associated with your Postmates account. I will be happy to look into this further and get this fixed.

scraped_reviews.content: They don't verify establishments. I ordered from places that my driver had to tell me were closed, no longer in business, and "not on the menu." If that's not bad enough you have to pretty much have double or triple the amount your order cost so that they can hold it for a couple of days. Oh and free delivery is only above $12, but the app told me I had free delivery anyway.

App/website frequently doesn't work, orders are usually wrong, orders are often (OFTEN - probably 80% of the time) randomly cancelled without explanation, ruining your plans. This is after the order is accepted and scheduled for a particular time. Menus and prices are usually inaccurate, resulting in much higher bills than expected. Absolutely abysmal service. Use only as a last resort.

Super convenient, can be expensive but worth it as a nice treat when you don't want to leave your home. The postmate can make all the difference, we modify our orders and ask for extras, lots of details to pay attention to and they are missed half of the time. I wish there were more places linked to Postmates but they keep adding more so that's good. Make sure to give detailed directions as well, if it's dark outside 100% of the drivers can't find our apartment because the building #s are hiden

On Nov 2nd, promo stopped working & went under the "Expired Promo" section despite the fact that it still stated "Expired on Nov 3". The prices for delivery, taxes, & fees are higher than their competitors. The general layout isn't efficient--instead of selecting an individual menu section, it's all in one place & you have to scroll through everything. Most items don't have options to check, you have to type all specifications. Most don't even have a section to add special instructions.

BE WARNED!!! They, and the other companies like them, overcharge you on every item you order off the menu. I understand paying delivery fee for the service being provided, but overcharging by an increase of $1, $2, and $3 ON EACH INDIVIDUAL ITEM?! I'm sure a lot of people don't even realize they're doing this! POSTMATES EVEN DOES THIS IF YOU ORDER PICKUP!!! Take a minute and compare them to the actual restaurant's order for pickup page and see how much extra you're paying by using Postmates!

Their menu price "estimate" (they inform me that there is no way they can be accurate with their pricing so they just give an estimate. Funny, every other service I've used doesn't have this problem.) was off by $9 on one item alone. The initial bill and what the delivery driver sent from restaurant both matched but final bill did not. There were items missing from the order that I was charged for, and to top it off, they charged me $7 for their "service." Rip off, stay away

Policys are NOT TRANSPARENT !! First off Delivery person was on time and the order was correct. Now customer service on the other hand is not very helpful like they are reading a book or something. I place an order i hit check out and when the order was on its way the price increased from 20 to 28. I contacted customer service and they sent me the invoice i already had. After some back and fourth they said for some vendors the price can change and the checkout price is just an estimate. Really?

Keeps spamming free delivery notifications. Decide to check it out. I noticed they added a markup for ordering through their service. 20 piece nugget from a McDonald's is $4.99. They charge $6.25. Then they add fees and taxes. Brings total to a little over $8.00. But hey, they waived the $5.99 delivery, right? Such a scam. Still have to tip the driver so they get some money, so realistically, looking at over double to have it delivered. Just wow.

I like the app but postmates does overcharge you quite a bit. For example, the other day I was going to place an order which came out to be $41 before taxes. I have unlimited (free deliveries), decided to go in person and place the exact same order instead, my total came out to be $33 out the door. So postmates was going to over charge me by $10, plus the tip to the driver. So I saved at least $15 dollars by going myself. Might cancel my subscription now.

This app is a true representative of fraud.. all items are marked up from the true price. Add to that: charge you service fee, delivery fee, and ask for tipping the delivery person. Beside all four charges, they have misleading promotions. They say you'll get $100 in delivery which expires a few days later.. you'll never be able to spend a fraction of that in a few days! Having ads everywhere on Youtube of pushy celebrities tells you one thing: THEY SUCK BIG TIME!!

the one word, run! There is zero customer service, and most of the drivers are careless and negligent. they used to put a hold on your account for a ridiculous amount. For example, let's say I ordered something that's worth $12, they would put a hold on my account for $97. what if I don't have that much and my account goes negative and I have to pay a $30 fee? My last three orders was a reasonable amount. My last order was not only incomplete but soup spilled everywhere. they wont give refund.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Dear Hovo,

Thanks for the feedback, and my apologies for any inconvenience you may have experienced with our service recently. If you don't mind, reply to the email that will be generated from this response, with the email associated with your Postmates account. I will be happy to look into this further and get this fixed!

scraped_reviews.content: I had more than half of my order wrong, 3 items that were made correctly, 3 items that were made incorrectly for someone with an allergy, and the 2 drinks we got were not the drinks we ordered and were only half full. I send the report to postmates, and they offer me a $3.50 credit, not even the cost of one item from the order that was made wrong. Had to order from somewhere else so my friend would have lunch as well. This is the worst customer service I have ever had with a food delivery app.

title: Google TV
description: Google TV, previously Play Movies & TV, makes it easy to find and enjoy the entertainment you love in one place. With Google TV, you'll be able to: Find what to watch next Browse 700,000+ movies and TV episodes from across your streaming apps, all in one place and organized into topics and genres. Discover new things with recommendations based on what you love and what‚Äôs trending across the services you already have access to. Search for titles to see which streaming apps offer them. See the latest releases Buy or rent the newest movies and shows right in the Shop tab. Purchases are stored in your Library and can be downloaded to watch when you're not connected. Watch instantly on your laptop, Android phone or tablet, or on your TV with Google TV or on Play Movies & TV where available. One list for all your discoveries Add interesting shows and movies to your Watchlist to keep track of your new discoveries and view them later. The Watchlist is shared between all your devices, so you can even add to your Watchlist from your TV or phone and laptop through Search on any browser. Use your phone as your remote With a remote built right into the app, you can find something great to watch even when the couch has eaten your remote. And you can use your phone‚Äôs keyboard to quickly type complicated passwords, movie names or search terms on your Google TV or other Android TV OS device. Pantaya is a service only available in the US. Separate subscriptions required for certain streaming services or access to certain content.
descriptionHTML:
Google TV, previously Play Movies & TV, makes it easy to find and enjoy the entertainment you love in one place. With Google TV, you'll be able to:
Find what to watch next
Browse 700,000+ movies and TV episodes from across your streaming apps, all in one place and organized into topics and genres. Discover new things with recommendations based on what you love and what‚Äôs trending across the services you already have access to. Search for titles to see which streaming apps offer them.
See the latest releases
Buy or rent the newest movies and shows right in the Shop tab. Purchases are stored in your Library and can be downloaded to watch when you're not connected. Watch instantly on your laptop, Android phone or tablet, or on your TV with Google TV or on Play Movies & TV where available.
One list for all your discoveries
Add interesting shows and movies to your Watchlist to keep track of your new discoveries and view them later. The Watchlist is shared between all your devices, so you can even add to your Watchlist from your TV or phone and laptop through Search on any browser.
Use your phone as your remote
With a remote built right into the app, you can find something great to watch even when the couch has eaten your remote. And you can use your phone‚Äôs keyboard to quickly type complicated passwords, movie names or search terms on your Google TV or other Android TV OS device.
Pantaya is a service only available in the US.
Separate subscriptions required for certain streaming services or access to certain content.
summary: Easily discover, watch, and stream your favorite movies and shows in one place

Zero stars! TV remote no longer works properly. Used to use it all the time and rely on it, now it's changed format very slow to react! No haptic feedback unless swiping on the pad and the centre button to select doesn't work in either swipe or d-pad mode. Only works randomly, despite rebooting or resetting. Horrendous! You have ruined a previously essential feature and made it impossible to use! Only workaround is to uninstall update & now works perfectly again in the previous better format.

The remote option has been ruined with the latest update. The swipe control does not work at all. I'm not able to use the keypad option to write in my Android TV. It forces me to use the D-Pad control option which is very inconvenient. There was literally no need to have any kind of update on nearly perfect app. I have shared the feedback on help& feedback options as well. Please fix it.

I love this app so much, but it has become such a frequent problem that it bugs SOOO MUCH. I try to watch a movie, it refreshes itself and takes my screen to the main page, it'll start over my movie, and it'll just close out in general. please fix this, I would love to give it 5 stars.

It's pathetic, but it's the only way. quality is very clear.

the remote is absolutely stupid. If it isn't used for a minute, it isn't connected anymore, even though it says connected. It might reconnect in 5 or 20 seconds, or it just might not reconnect at all. I would throw my phone through my TV but it wouldn't hurt the app....

scraped_reviews.content: This app UX is so poor. You have to click all over the place to find your downloaded files.
